column2: NEW JERSEY DMV WRITTEN TEST
Question Text
1. When approaching someone using a white cane, you should proceed with caution because:
column10: the pedestrian might be using a guide dog.

column2: 2. What should you do if your headlights suddenly go out?
column4: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column6: Brake immediately and activate your emergency lights.
column8: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column10: Use your emergency lights, parking lights or directional signals.

column2: 3. What do pennant-shaped signs indicate?
4. If a driver follows you too closely, you should:
column4: increase your speed as you are probably driving too slowly.
column6: move to another lane if possible.

column2: 5. If your gas pedal is stuck, you should:
column4: try pumping it to increase pressure.
column6: hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it. If not, shift into neutral and use the brake to slow your vehicle and get off the road.
column8: ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column10: turn off the ignition if your vehicle has power steering.

column2: 6. A broken yellow line alongside a solid yellow line means:
column4: Passing is not permitted in either direction
column6: Passing on the right is permitted in either direction
column8: Passing is permitted on the side of the broken yellow line
column10: Passing is permitted on the side of the solid yellow line

column2: 7. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: they must turn either to the right or left.
column6: there is a double curve ahead.
column10: there is a winding road ahead.

column2: 8. When they see a yellow X signal, drivers should:
column4: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.
column10: prepare to leave the lane safely.

column2: 9. It is important for drivers to know that trucks:
column4: require more space for turning movements.
column6: are easier for the driver to operate.
column8: take longer than cars to stop.
column10: require less time to pass on an incline than cars.

column2: 10. This sign means:
11. An edge line that angles toward the center of the road indicates that:
12. This road sign means:
13. Smoking while driving:
14. When you make a left turn from a two-way road into a four-lane highway, you must:
column4: go straight through the intersection, and then make the turn.
column6: enter the left lane, to the right of the center line.
column8: enter the right lane. When traffic permits, you can move out of the left lane.
column10: enter the right lane, to the left of the center line.

column2: 15. Yellow traffic signs:
column4: when combined with an octagonal shape, tell drivers they must come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column2: 16. Examples of proper glass maintenance include:
column4: Making sure there is enough windshield fluid in the reservoir.
column6: Keeping your windows clean and clear.

column2: 17. This road sign indicates that:
column4: buses and car pools may not travel in the restricted lane.
column6: a lane is reserved for certain purposes or certain vehicles.
column8: vehicles cannot go straight ahead. Cars must turn either to the right or left.

column2: 18. Are drivers allowed to exceed the speed limit to pass other vehicles?
column4: Yes, but only if they drive with caution.
column10: Yes, but only by 10 MPH or less.

column2: 19. To avoid having to make an emergency stop while driving in traffic, drivers should:
column4: drive in the right lane only.
column6: sound their horn to warn other drivers.
column8: drive slower than the flow of traffic.
column10: look ahead and maintain a safe following distance.

column2: 20. Drinking alcohol while taking drugs can:
column8: have a more pronounced effect than either taken separately.
column10: have a less pronounced effect than either taken separately.

column2: 21. When driving in bad weather, drivers should:
column8: increase their speed to get to their destination more quickly.

column2: 22. If your brakes are wet, you can dry them by:
column4: pull over to the right and wait until it stops raining.
column8: having them checked by a mechanic.

column2: 23. This road sign means:
24. An octagonal sign means that drivers must:
column8: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column2: 25. When the road is slippery, you should:
column4: press your brakes in slow, steady strokes.
column10: use your emergency or parking brake.

column2: 26. If your car starts to skid, turn your steering wheel:
column4: in the opposite direction of the skid.
column6: in any direction. It doesnt matter.
column8: to keep the front wheels straight.
column10: in the direction you want to go.

column2: 27. This road sign means:
28. This road sign means:
column8: A road joins from the right

column2: 29. If an intersection has crosswalk lines but no STOP line, where must you stop for a red light?
30. The Implied Consent Law means that:
column4: all passengers agree to wear their seat belts.
column6: you agree to let other passengers drive your vehicle after drinking alcohol.
column8: you agree to take a breath test when under arrest and suspected of drinking and driving.

column2: 31. This road sign means:
32. At intersections where two or more drivers stop at STOP signs at the same time and they are at right angles:
column4: the driver on the left must yield to the driver on the right.
column6: the driver who was going faster before stopping must yield.
column8: the driver on the right must yield to the driver on the left.
column10: the driver who is late for work has the right-of-way.

column2: 33. Air bags are meant to _________ seat belts.
34. When children are close, what should you do before you back out of a driveway?
column6: Get out of the car and check behind the car.
column8: Look through your back window for children.

column2: 35. Diamond-shaped signs:
column8: are used to warn of hazards on roadways.

column2: 36. On average, how long does it take your body to remove the alcohol contained in 5 ounces of wine?
37. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: be ready to brake sharply and stop.
column6: yield to trucks coming from the hill on the right.
column8: be ready to shift to lower gear.

column2: 38. Pentagonal signs are used to indicate:
39. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they can not safely return to the right lane before any oncoming vehicle comes within 200 feet of them.
column6: they approach a curve on a two-way road and can not see around it.
column8: their lane has a solid yellow center line.

column2: 40. When driving on slick roads, drivers should:
column6: drive as they would on dry roads.

column2: 41. When getting ready to change lanes, you should:
column6: quickly turn your head to check for other vehicles.

column2: 42. Drive below the posted speed limit when:
column4: anything makes conditions less than perfect.
column6: others drive below the speed limit.
column8: you are on a four lane road.
column10: entering a highway where there are other cars.

column2: 43. After parking, are you allowed to open a door on the road side of your vehicle?
column6: Yes, but only if oncoming vehicles or bicycles are at least 10 feet away.
column10: Yes, but only if it does not interfere with bicyclists and other traffic.

column2: 44. Warning signs normally are:
45. If you stop along the road at night:
column4: turn off your emergency lights and leave your high beams on.
column8: turn on your emergency flashers and leave your low beams on.

column2: 46. What should drivers do when the red lights begin to flash?
47. A large vehicle is backing up to unload goods. You should:
column6: be patient and wait until the large vehicle has completed its backup maneuver.
column8: enter one of the blind spots and wait.

column2: 48. At night, it is hardest to see:
49. Drivers may continue carefully through a yellow light if:
column6: an emergency vehicle is crossing your lane.
column10: they already are within the intersection.

column2: 50. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: the one-way street or roadway is about to change to two-way traffic.
column8: they are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
